byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from London.

abstract: Pakistani officials say that dozens of militants and Pakistani soldiers have died in fighting as army attempts to gain control of militant stronghold Tirah Valley.
lead_paragraph: Dozens of pro-Taliban militants and at least 16 soldiers have died in fighting in the Tirah Valley, on the border with Afghanistan, officials said.

headline.main: Pakistani Army Begins Offensive to Drive Militants From Tirah Valley
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Pakistan: Army Clashes With Insurgents

snippet: Dozens of pro-Taliban militants and at least 16 soldiers have died in fighting in the Tirah Valley, on the border with Afghanistan, officials said.
